content.description: With the exit to the cave to your left, use the hanging sharp stalagtites to start and work your way left and then up towards to holes in the top of the cave.  Amazing location, razor sharp rock so be sure to tape up your fingers.  The cave is dusty as others have mentioned.
content.protection: TR by setting a sling around the arch that spans the roof hole, and back it up with both a second sling/cordalette as the rock is super sharp.  Good idea to back it up with natural boulder pro above the hole as well.
content.location: Drive 5 miles down Aiken Mine Road and walk a few hundred feet from the parking area to the cave entrance (you can see the entrance with a metal staircase). Descend the staircase and go left, you have to crouch and go under a rock roof and then the cave quickly opens up into a cavern fed with natural light from the roof.

content.description: Slightly more difficult and just left of From the depths of hell, this climb features a distinct crux moving out of the starting overhang. Find the right hold!
content.protection: Top rope anchor can be set up by slinging arch in the hole above. Back it up by slinging a solid rock nearby at the surface!
content.location: Just left of From the depths of hell.

content.description: Obvious overhanging route that climbs out of the cave through the hole in the ceiling. Easy to navigate the sharp and obvious holds.
content.protection: Top rope it by setting up an anchor above (sling the arch and back it up).
content.location: Walk down the cave until you reach the large hole in the ceiling. Turn left to face the wall. This climb starts slightly the right with holds in a shallow crack-like feature.
